definitions: Past tense and past participle of 'spoil', meaning to diminish or destroy the value or quality of.
Past tense and past participle of 'spoil', meaning to harm the character of (a child) by being too lenient or permissive.
Past tense and past participle of 'spoil', meaning to treat with excessive indulgence; pamper.
examples: The picnic was spoilt by the sudden rain.
The child was spoilt by her grandparents.
He spoilt his chances by arriving late.
